newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Traders detail India July diesel tender awards.
newsitem.headline: Traders detail India July diesel tender awards.

text.p: US major Mobil and Swiss trader Glencore were each awarded three cargoes of gas oil (diesel) in state-owned Indian Oil Corp's (IOC) tender for July delivery, traders said on Friday.
Mobil was awarded two cargoes of 1.0-percent sulphur gas oil and one cargo of 0.25 percent sulphur grade, while Glencore was awarded one cargo each of of 1.0, 0.5 and 0.25 percent sulphur gas oil.

The other winners are Kuwait Petroleum Corp (KPC) and western trader Cargill each with two cargoes of 1.0 percent sulphur gas oil, Mediterranean trader Galaxy and European major Shell both with a cargo each of 1.0 and 0.5 percent grade.
Japanese trader Tomen and Italian refiner Agip had one cargo each of 1.0-percent grade, while French refiner Total SA and European major British Petroleum had one cargo each of the 0.5-percent grade.

Traders noted that while India's award of 855,000 tonnes in 19 cargoes had a bullish effect on the swaps gas oil market on Thursday, the market slipped again this morning as traders digested its real impact.

They noted that the Asian and MidEast markets remained awashed with gas oil while most of awarded cargoes are of the 1.0-percent sulphur grade rather than the 0.5 percent grade which dominate the Asian markets.
IOC also took about 90,000 tonnes of the 0.25 percent grade.
India took 315,000 tonnes of gas oil in its tender for June deliveries and 870,000 tonnes in May.
June gas oil swaps dipped to $25.05/$25.20 per barrel from Thursday's $25.15/$25.25, while July was indicated at $25.00/$25./15, down from $25.05/$25.15.
The details of the tender are as follows (cost-and-freight basis:)
Gas oil sulphur grade Seller Premium Port
